channel.title: Building a new computer
channel.description:
My video card basically died the other day (9 FPS in CS) so I decided it was time to build a new computer. I don't need a new monitor, nor do I need any need HDD and I'm pretty sure I'm fine with my supply of RAM. I use my computer for everything. Lots of gaming, graphic design, media, programming, and just general computing. What would you recommend?
Thanks :)

item.title: Building a new computer
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

I was an AMD guy until around 1.5 years ago when they began to suck, since then Intel have made all the advancements.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a new computer
item.dc:creator: @Cultivated Cultivated
item.description:
@Cultivated wrote:

[quote=“Holic, post:14, topic:207481”][quote author=Aim link=topic=273461.msg2242286#msg2242286 date=1211749373]
AMD 64 quad processor, nvidia 9600, compaq case.
[/quote]
I plan to stay with Intel.[/quote]
Intel may be better, but I’d go with AMD over Intel anyday. AMD makes the advances…Intel follows their lead, and improves upon it.

If your current computer has DDR2, then your fine on ram. I’d suggest Nvidia 8 series, I don’t like 9. (Mainly because there aren’t any good PCI-E 2.0 AMD boards out that aren’t crap.) Asus ftw as far as mobo’s go.

AMD is so humble XD

Read full topic

item.title: Building a new computer
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

Aim:

AMD 64 quad processor, nvidia 9600, compaq case.

I plan to stay with Intel.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a new computer
item.dc:creator: @postmanpat9 postmanpat9
item.description:
@postmanpat9 wrote:

Don’t get the 9600 it is an absolute shit card and as for the amd quad core intel have much better quad’s and dual cores out.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a new computer
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“postmanpat9, post:10, topic:207481”][quote author=Greeny link=topic=273461.msg2239413#msg2239413 date=1211593152]
Just another word, stick to DDR2 RAM at the minute as DDR3 is good but it is stupidly expensive.
[/quote]
And if you want you can just o’c your dd2 ram.[/quote]

GL OCing DD2 ram to DD3 speeds

But yes, you can OC it.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a new computer
item.dc:creator: @postmanpat9 postmanpat9
item.description:
@postmanpat9 wrote:

And if you want you can just o’c your dd2 ram.
And don’t forget to tighten the timings on it when you get it.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a new computer
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Just another word, stick to DDR2 RAM at the minute as DDR3 is good but it is stupidly expensive.

item.title: Building a new computer
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

The PSU is around $100, give or take $10 if they’re offering a rebate or not (thats US Dollars BTW).

Newegg has all the right prices, even if you don’t live in the US you should base your prices on there.

As for the graphics card, I wasn’t thinking and you should definitely go with either the 9800 GX2, or an 8800 series because the 9600GT is series IS shit, I wasn’t think that much last night because I came back from Hershey Park and was up since 4 in the morning.

Glad I could help.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a new computer
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

Thanks RXVL, I really like what you’ve picked out.
I probably will be changing the graphics card but other than that, me likey.
That stuff you picked out will add upto $850-$900? I wasn’t sure about the PSU’s price.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a new computer
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Unless you get a 9800 the 8800 GT/GTXs are still better than the 9600. Especially when it comes to price.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a new computer
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

GFX Card: EVGA nVidia GeForce 9600 GT (650 Mhz Core Speed, don’t bother buying one with a higher core speed, it’s just factory overclocked, do it yourself)

Mobo: EVGA nVidia nForce 650i (680i if you want better)

Proc: Intel Core 2 Duo E8400

PSU: PC Power and Cooling Silencer 610 Watt

Case: Antec 900? (Any thing you want, as long as it has at least 2 120mm fan holes for intake/exhaust.

I’m running practically the same thing except for a E6750 proc and a 9800GX2.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a new computer
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

belbn:

Go to newegg.com buy the best stuff you can in the category you need. simple. =]

Can’t because I’m Canadian, but I have been checking out TigerDirect

[quote=“frank_, post:3, topic:207481”]it sounds as though you just want a new graphics card, motherboard and processor

depending on how much you are willing to spend, i would be inclined to suggest an nvidia 8800 or 9600 for a video card and a core 2 duo/quad for a processor[/quote]
Yeah, I was thinking of just getting a new GFX card, motherboard and processor but then I would also need a new PSU and a new case.
Thanks though, I’ll look into it.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a new computer
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

it sounds as though you just want a new graphics card, motherboard and processor

depending on how much you are willing to spend, i would be inclined to suggest an nvidia 8800 or 9600 for a video card and a core 2 duo/quad for a processor

Read full topic
